abstracts.cdata!:
The project seeks to assist the
            Government in developing more effective programs of
            reforestation and of tree farming by farmers with small- and
            medium-sized holdings. The reforestation component of the
            project is designed to assist the Government in developing
            3,000 ha of much needed pine plantations and in learning to
            deal more effectively with the problem of shifting
            cultivation and grazing in forest reserves. The tree farming
            component would provide credit and technical services to
            tree farmers to assist them in establishing commercially
            viable tree farms on marginal agricultural lands. Almost all
            the beneficiaries under the smallholder tree farming
            component would be farmers whose present incomes are lower
            than the absolute poverty level; the project would help to
            double their incomes in four to eight years. The main risks
            relate to the reforestation component of the project and
            include the need for adequate protection of plantation
            trees, possible resettlement of people in the project areas,
            and the responsiveness of the tree species planted to local
            growing conditions; the project has been designed to
            minimize these risks.
